net.wombatrpgs.mgne.global
Interface Reporter

All Known Implementing Classes:
DebugReporter
public interface Reporter

A thing for reporting errors/exceptions. It should be called ErrorReporter or something but seeing as this class is going to get used all the damn time I figured it should have a fun name. This is an interface because potentially different distributions should handle their errors differently.

Method Summary

          When you're too lazy to write an error message.
 void err(java.lang.String error)

 void err(java.lang.String error, java.lang.Exception e)
          An exception happened, and now what are you going to do? Call this, of course! It should probably be related to the other err function, like print a stack trace in addition or something.

Method Detail

inform

void inform(java.lang.String info)
Reports some debug information. Where this goes is ~~unknown~~ but the idea is that it shouldn't be done unless some special debug mode is set.

Parameters:
info - The info string to dump

warn

void warn(java.lang.String warning)
Another debug-ish function. Where it goes is unknown but it probably shouldn't happen in a deploy environment.

Parameters:
warning - The warning string to dump

warn

void warn(java.lang.String error,
          java.lang.Exception e)
Warn clone if an error should be handled.

Parameters:
error - Descripting of the problem
e - The exception generated

err

void err(java.lang.String error)
This is the function to call when shit hits the fan. Recover if possible, but log anything that's probably fatal here.

Parameters:
error - The error that occurred

err

void err(java.lang.String error,
         java.lang.Exception e)
An exception happened, and now what are you going to do? Call this, of course! It should probably be related to the other err function, like print a stack trace in addition or something.

Parameters:
error - The error that occured (descriptive message)
e - The exception that threw up

err

void err(java.lang.Exception e)
When you're too lazy to write an error message.

Parameters:
e - The exception that threw up
